You feel a pang of loneliness, knowing that there is no one else here with you in this infinite library. The concept of distance becomes more personal, and you wonder if the vastness of space between yourself and others is what makes your existence so unique.

Do we lose something essential when we're removed from others, or can our thoughts and feelings transcend physical boundaries?

You think about how the Pythagorean theorem helps calculate distance, but you wonder if there are other ways to measure distance that don't involve numbers. Are there different types of distances, some more meaningful than others?
